subject: Re: [junit] Re: Junit testing of web services
msgSnippet: ... Oh, you ve gotta love this. Someone who dumps a quick please give me info about testing web services email, is now taking me to task about not making
messageBody:
On 9/2/06, vkv3056 <vkv3056@...> wrote:
> Thanks for your response. But you could have safely assumed that
> anyone asking for use of Junit for web services would necessarily
> have common sense of using any of the major search engines. Instead
> of sermons on helping me exercise search engine skills, some
> concrete info would have been more useful (for example, look at
> other responses on this topic).

Oh, you've gotta love this. Someone who dumps a quick "please give me
info about testing web services" email, is now taking me to task about
not making dramatically unlikely assumptions about their level of
knowledge.

The vast majority of emails that come through this list of the type
"pls u snd me junit info thnx" are from folks who have not used a
search engine and who are lazy beyond belief. These folks are welcome
to receive help when they start following the advice in ESR's "asking
smart questions". For the record, I also suggest that you read it. You
gave no indication that you had ever touched a search engine. You gave
no indication that you knew anything about web services beyond the
correct spelling of the words. Here's the link (see, I can be
helpful):

http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html

I also noticed quite a large number of useful looking links when I
googled for "testing web services junit". If I could find them, I have
no idea why you couldn't.

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.org
